docs.snippet: LEAD:    OIL AND THE MIDEAST       So far, the oil-price run-up reflects expectations, not reality. And the anticipation could be worse than the outcome. No one, of course, knows just what a war would bring. [Page A1.]      Oil prices plowed...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: OIL AND THE MIDEAST So far, the oil-price run-up reflects expectations, not reality. And the anticipation could be worse than the outcome. No one, of course, knows just what a war would bring. [Page A1.] Oil prices plowed stubbornly ahead despite Bush's effort to tame them by announcing a test withdrawal from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Blending humanitarian concerns with military ones, President Bush arrived in New York yesterday to attend an international summit meeting on children and to engage in three days of aerobic diplomacy designed to send President Saddam Hussein of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Blending humanitarian concerns with military ones, President Bush arrived in New York yesterday to attend an international summit meeting on children and to engage in three days of aerobic diplomacy designed to send President Saddam Hussein of Iraq a signal that the world's patience is running out.

headline.main: Bush Is in New York for the U.N. Conference and a Flurry of Gulf Diplomacy

docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States and Chile signed an agreement today to monitor their growing trade and investment relationship and lay the groundwork for broader free trade under proposals made by President Bush last June.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States and Chile signed an agreement today to monitor their growing trade and investment relationship and lay the groundwork for broader free trade under proposals made by President Bush last June.

headline.main: U.S. Signs Trade Pact With Chile

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Parked in the open door of a workshop on a nondescript Montevideo side street, the low-slung pale yellow car created its own Art Deco time warp. Its cockpit-style dashboard, interior radiator, retractable headlights and front-wheel traction -...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Parked in the open door of a workshop on a nondescript Montevideo side street, the low-slung pale yellow car created its own Art Deco time warp. Its cockpit-style dashboard, interior radiator, retractable headlights and front-wheel traction - decades ahead of their time - make Errett Lobban Cord's dream machine as alive today as it was when it drove the

headline.main: Uruguay: Unlikely Capital For Antique-Car Sales

docs.snippet: LEAD: Brazil's congressional election last week was no routine midterm vote. President Fernando Collor de Mello came to power in March with an ambitious program of radical, free-market reform but without a strong party behind him to enact the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Brazil's congressional election last week was no routine midterm vote. President Fernando Collor de Mello came to power in March with an ambitious program of radical, free-market reform but without a strong party behind him to enact the required legislation. Now the voters have turned sharply against his opponents from the Socialist left.

headline.main: Boldness in Brazil Needs a Boost

docs.snippet: LEAD: The House failed today to overturn President Bush's veto of a bill cutting imports of textiles, apparel and shoes.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The House failed today to overturn President Bush's veto of a bill cutting imports of textiles, apparel and shoes.

headline.main: House Fails to Overturn Bush Veto of Import Bill

byline.original: By CLYDE H. FARNSWORTH, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The European Community today failed for the second time this week to endorse a plan designed to break a deadlock with the United States over farm-subsidy policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The European Community today failed for the second time this week to endorse a plan designed to break a deadlock with the United States over farm-subsidy policy.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The White House announced today that President Bush will visit Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay and Venezuela from Dec. 2 to Dec. 8 on a trip to improve ties with Latin America that was put off last summer because of budget negotiations. Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The White House announced today that President Bush will visit Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay and Venezuela from Dec. 2 to Dec. 8 on a trip to improve ties with Latin America that was put off last summer because of budget negotiations. Mr. Bush will also meet with President Carlos Salinas de Gortari of Mexico in Monterrey, Mexico, on Nov.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Uruguay and its commercial bankers announced an initial agreement yesterday to reorganize the country's $1.6 billion in foreign bank loans, including provisions to reduce the country's debt.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Uruguay and its commercial bankers announced an initial agreement yesterday to reorganize the country's $1.6 billion in foreign bank loans, including provisions to reduce the country's debt.

headline.main: Uruguay and Banks Reach Accord on Debt
